intro: Dicoelospermum ritchiei, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with a distinctive, narrow shape, and it is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, adapted to reduce water loss. Dicoelospermum ritchiei is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
